intro: Haplopappus hoorebekia, commonly known as the Hoorebeek's pappus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, typical of the family. Haplopappus hoorebekia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to harsh, dry environments.
